title: Prestigious music competition website with application flow, video submission, payment, and FAQs

requirements.text: Create a professional, prestigious marketing website for a music competition for the “Jane Elissa Extravaganza” with clear messaging that the winner performs at an annual Times Square New York event with Broadway stars.

quotes: Website for a music competition. Needs website to look super professional and prestigious. Winner gets to perform at the Jane Elissa Extravaganza - an annual performance in Times Square New York with Broadway Stars.

acceptanceCriteria: Site has a clear home/landing page that states the competition purpose and the winner prize (performance at the Jane Elissa Extravaganza in Times Square NYC with Broadway stars).
Navigation provides access to at least: Home, Apply, FAQs.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a coherent visual theme that feels “super professional and prestigious” (e.g., refined typography, high-contrast palette such as charcoal/ivory with gold accents, generous spacing, formal layout) and apply it consistently across all pages.

quotes: Needs website to look super professional and prestigious.

acceptanceCriteria: A single consistent theme is applied across pages (typography, colors, buttons, forms, and section styling).
The design avoids casual/“startup” styling and instead uses a formal, premium look.

requirements.text: Add an FAQs page (or dedicated FAQs section accessible from navigation) containing competition-related frequently asked questions and answers.
acceptanceCriteria: FAQs are accessible from the main navigation.
FAQs are displayed in a readable, professional format (e.g., accordion or clearly separated Q/A blocks).

requirements.text: Add an “Apply” page with an application form that allows an applicant to either (a) upload a video file or (b) provide a YouTube video link, plus required applicant contact fields.

quotes: Have a page for application. You have to submit a video or a link to a YouTube video

acceptanceCriteria: Application form includes applicant contact fields (at minimum: full name and email) and a video submission section with two options: upload a file OR paste a YouTube link.
Form validation enforces that exactly one video submission method is provided (upload OR YouTube link).
On successful submission, the user sees a clear success confirmation.
Backend persists submitted applications (including contact info, submission method, and timestamp) so they can be retrieved later.

requirements.text: Collect a 75 CAD application fee as part of the application submission flow using an online payment step, and store the resulting payment status/details with the application record.
acceptanceCriteria: The Apply flow clearly indicates the fee amount as 75 CAD before payment.
Users can complete an online payment step and then submit (or finalize) the application.
Backend stores a payment status for each application (e.g., pending/paid) along with any non-sensitive payment reference returned to the app.
Users cannot finalize an application as “paid/complete” without going through the payment step (per the app’s implemented payment flow).

requirements.text: Add cause/impact messaging stating that funds raised through application fees go towards leukemia and cancer research.

quotes: funds raised through application fees will go towards leukemia and cancer research.

acceptanceCriteria: Cause/impact messaging appears on the site in at least one prominent location (e.g., Home page and/or Apply page).
Wording clearly states that application fees support leukemia and cancer research.

requirements.text: Provide a backend query suitable for an internal/admin view to list submitted applications (most recent first), including key fields and payment status.

quotes: Have a page for application...submit a video...pay 75 CAD.

acceptanceCriteria: There is a backend method that returns a list of application records including: name, email, submission type, video reference (file metadata or YouTube URL), created timestamp, and payment status.
Results are ordered with newest applications first.

requirements.text: Generate and include a small set of custom static brand images that reinforce a prestigious competition identity, and use them in the UI as static assets (not served via the backend).

quotes: Needs website to look super professional and prestigious.

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
At least a logo/crest and a hero/background visual are visibly used in the site UI.

constraints: Use the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind + shadcn/ui + React Query stack on the frontend.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths; compose them from app code instead.
No third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is allowed if authentication is needed (not required by this request).
nonGoals: Admin authentication/role management for viewing submissions (not requested).
Automated verification of payment with a secret server-side Stripe integration (not requested explicitly; implement the best possible online payment step within platform constraints).
Public directory of applicants or public voting features (not requested).

required: Minimalist crest-style logo mark with elegant typography feel (competition-crest-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide cinematic hero banner with abstract stage lights / concert hall ambience, dark luxurious palette (hero-banner.dim_1920x800.png)
Subtle repeating background pattern (e.g., faint laurel/notes motif), seamless tile (background-pattern-tile.dim_512x512.png)
